meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound or cry
meanings.sent1: The mouse let out a tiny squeak when it saw the cat.
meanings.sent2: I heard a squeak coming from the old door as it opened.
meanings.sent3: The squeak of the rusty swing made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The squeak of the violin filled the room with its delicate melody.
meanings.sent5: The high-pitched squeak of the brakes warned us of the approaching train.

meanings.definition: To make a short, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The puppy would squeak whenever it wanted attention.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally stepped on a toy that made me squeak in surprise.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to squeak as it slowly deflated.
meanings.sent4: The hinges squeaked loudly as I opened the creaky door.
meanings.sent5: The rubber duck would squeak when squeezed during bath time.

meanings.definition: A narrow escape or close call
meanings.sent1: It was a squeak that we caught the last train home.
meanings.sent2: The car missed hitting the deer by a squeak.
meanings.sent3: The team's victory was a squeak after a tough match.
meanings.sent4: She made it to the bus stop by a squeak before the bus arrived.
meanings.sent5: The rescue team arrived in the nick of time, saving the hiker by a squeak.
